SEARCH
Package org.example.client

Class TCPClient

java.lang.Object
org.example.client.TCPClient
public class TCPClient extends Object
The TCPClient class handles the client-side logic for connecting to a server using TCP. It manages the connection, handles incoming messages, and sends user input to the server.

  • Constructor Details

    • TCPClient

      public TCPClient(String ip, int port, View view)
      Constructor for TCPClient.
      Parameters:
      ip - The IP address of the server.
      port - The port number of the server.
      view - The view interface for interacting with the user.

  • Method Details

    • startTCPClient

      public void startTCPClient() throws Exception
      Starts the TCP client, establishes a connection to the server, and manages input/output. This method attempts to connect to the server using the provided IP and port. Upon successful connection, it sets up input and output streams to handle communication with the server. It also starts a thread to listen for messages from the server and another thread to handle user input, sending valid inputs to the server.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • sendUsername

      public void sendUsername(String username)
      Sends the username to the server after the connection is established.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to send.

    • sendColorAndNumPlayers

      public void sendColorAndNumPlayers(String color, String numPlayers)
      Sends the chosen color and number of players to the server.
      Parameters:
      color - The chosen color.
      numPlayers - The number of players.

    • sendSetObjStarter

      public void sendSetObjStarter(int side, int choice)
      Sends the object starter set command to the server.
      Parameters:
      side - The side for setting the object starter.
      choice - The choice made for the object starter.

    • sendChat

      public void sendChat(String message)

    • sendDraw

      public void sendDraw(int choice)

    • sendPlay

      public void sendPlay(int choice, int side, int x, int y)
      Sends the play command to the server.
      Parameters:
      choice - The choice of the play.
      side - The side for the play.
      x - The x-coordinate for the play.
      y - The y-coordinate for the play.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the client is currently connected to the server.
      Returns:
      true if the socket is not null, connected, and not closed; false otherwise.
